question: What is heat?
Which of the following is a source of heat?
What is the unit of heat?
Which method of heat transfer occurs in liquids and gases?
What is conduction?
options: Transfer of heat through direct contact
Transfer of heat through a fluid
answer: Transfer of heat through direct contact

question: What happens when a solid is heated?
Which of the following materials is a good conductor of heat?
Which is an example of a poor conductor of heat?

What is the name of the temperature scale commonly used in the scientific community?
Which of the following is an example of heat transfer through radiation?
What is the freezing point of water in Celsius?
What is the boiling point of water in Celsius?
Which of the following substances expands when heated?
What is the name of the thermometer that uses mercury to measure temperature?
What is the process called when a liquid turns into a gas?
What happens during the process of condensation?
options: A gas turns into a liquid
A liquid turns into a solid
A gas turns into a solid
answer: A gas turns into a liquid

question: Which of the following is true about heat?
options: It can only travel in solids
It flows from a hot object to a cold object
answer: It flows from a hot object to a cold object

question: Which of the following is an example of convection?
What is the purpose of insulators in everyday life?
What is conduction?
options: Transfer of heat through direct contact
Transfer of heat through electromagnetic waves
answer: Transfer of heat through direct contact

question: Which of the following is the best conductor of heat?
Why does metal feel colder than wood at the same temperature?
options: Because metal is a poor conductor
Because metal is a good conductor and transfers heat away from the body faster
Because metal has a lower temperature than wood
answer: Because metal is a good conductor and transfers heat away from the body faster

question: Which material is an insulator of heat?
What is convection?
options: Transfer of heat through direct contact

question: Which of the following is an example of convection?
options: Heat transfer from a stove to a pan
Warm air rising in the atmosphere
answer: Warm air rising in the atmosphere

question: Why does hot air rise?
Which type of heat transfer occurs in boiling water?
Sea breezes and land breezes occur due to which mode of heat transfer?
Why are heating coils placed at the bottom of a water heater?
options: To allow convection currents to distribute heat evenly
answer: To allow convection currents to distribute heat evenly

question: What is thermal expansion?
options: Increase in temperature of an object
Increase in size of an object due to heat
Loss of heat from an object
answer: Increase in size of an object due to heat

question: Which of the following expands the most when heated?
What happens to the volume of a liquid when it is heated?
Why do liquid thermometers work?
options: Because liquids expand and contract with temperature changes
answer: Because liquids expand and contract with temperature changes

question: Which liquid is commonly used in thermometers due to its expansion properties?
Why are gaps left between railway tracks?
options: To allow trains to move smoothly
To prevent damage due to thermal expansion
To improve the strength of the tracks
answer: To prevent damage due to thermal expansion

question: Which of the following is an application of thermal expansion?
options: Absorption of heat by black surfaces

question: Why are overhead electric wires given some slack?
options: To prevent breaking in cold weather due to contraction
answer: To prevent breaking in cold weather due to contraction

question: Why do metal lids on glass jars become easier to open when heated?
options: Because metal expands more than glass
Because glass expands more than metal
answer: Because metal expands more than glass

question: Why do bridges have expansion joints?
options: To allow thermal expansion and contraction
answer: To allow thermal expansion and contraction

question: What happens when a metal ball is heated?
Which of the following materials expands the least when heated?
Which principle is used in a bimetallic strip?
options: Different metals expand at different rates
Metals expand and contract at the same rate
answer: Different metals expand at different rates

question: What happens to the density of a liquid when it is heated?
Why does water expand when it freezes?
options: Because of the arrangement of water molecules in ice
answer: Because of the arrangement of water molecules in ice
